entry.title: C陷阱与缺陷读书笔记 Part.2
entry.content:
第2章 语法“陷阱”

2.1 理解函数声明

书中提到一个例子，设计一个C程序，当计算机启动时，硬件将调用首地址为0位置的子例程。
给出的C语句如下：

  • (*(void(*) () ) 0) ();

构造这类表达式有一个简单的规则：按照使用的方式来声明。
任何C变量的声明都由两部分组成：类型以及一组类似表达式的声明符。声明符从表面上看与表达式类似，对它求值应该返回一个声明中给定类型的结果。
最简单的声明符是单个变量，如：

  • 这个声明的含义是：当对其求值时，表达式f和g的类型为浮点数类型，因为声明符与表达式类似，我们也可以在声明符中任意使用括号：
  • 这个声明的含义是：当对其求值时，((f))的类型为浮点类型，由此，f也是浮点类型。

相同的逻辑也适合于函数和指针类型的声明，如：

  • 这个声明的含义是：表达式ff()求值结果是一个浮点数，即，ff是一个返回值为浮点类型的函数。类似地，

  • 这个声明的含义是，*pf是一个浮点数，也就是说，pf是一个指向浮点数的指针。
    以上声明还可以组合起来，如：

  • 表示*g()和(*h)()是浮点表达式。因为()结合优先级高于*，*g()也就是*(g())，即g是一个函数，返回值的类型为指向浮点数的指针，同理，可以得出h是一个函数指针，h指向的函数返回值是浮点类型。

当我们知道了如何声明一个给定类型的变量，那么该类型的类型转换符就很容易得到：把声明中的变量名和声明末尾的分号去掉，再用括号把剩余部分括起来即可。如：

那么再来看(*(void(*) () ) 0) ();

  1. 假定fp是一个函数指针，则调用它指向的函数方法如下：
    (*fp)();
    因为fp是函数指针，则*fp就是指向的函数，所以(*fp)()就调用了这个函数。ANSI C还允许将这个式子简写为fp()，但是这只是简写。注意要有括号，否则*fp()等价于*(fp())，它相当于*((*fp)())的简写。

    在这里我也在想既然函数名()可以调用函数，(*函数指针)()也可以调用函数且可以简写成函数指针()，那么函数名本身是不是也类似于指针呢？尝试用(*函数名)()，发现也可以调用函数。又设置了一个函数指针指向函数，同时对函数名取地址，发现指针存的值和函数名的地址是相同的。那么函数名其实也是指向了一个地址，但函数名不能被赋值，可以看作是一个常量，值为指向这个函数本身的地址。有数组那味了。

  2. 找到一个合适的形式来替换fp。如果fp是一个指向返回值为void类型的函数的指针，那么(*fp)()的值为void，fp的声明如下：
    void (*fp)();
    因此，可以用以下语句来调用储存位置为0的子例程：

    当然，我们知道如何声明一个变量，同时也就知道了如何对常数进行类型转换，将其转型为该变量的类型(就像前文说的那样做即可)。因此，将常数0转为“指向返回值为void的函数的指针”类型，可以这样：
    (void (*) () ) 0;
    那么，用(void(*)()) 0来替换fp，从而得到：
    (* (void (*) () ) 0) ();

2.2 运算符的优先级问题

下表为C语言运算符有限表。由上至下，优先级依次递减。

运算符结合性
() [] -> .自左向右
！ ~ ++ – - (type) * & sizeof自右向左
* / %自左向右
+ -自左向右
<< >>自左向右
< <= > >=自左向右
== !=自左向右
&自左向右
^自左向右
|自左向右
&&自左向右
||自左向右
?:自右向左
assignments(赋值运算符)自右向左
,自左向右

最高优先级并非真正意义上的运算符，他们是数组下标、函数调用操作符以及结构成员选择操作符。自左至右结合，所以a.b.c的含义是(a.b).c，而不是a.(b.c)

单目运算符(只有一个操作数)仅次于前者，在真正意义上的运算符中，他们的优先级最高。类型转换也算作单目运算符，优先级和其他单目运算符相同，都是从右至左结合。

再次一级是双目运算符，双目运算符中，算数运算符优先级最高，移位运算符次之，关系运算符再次之，然后是逻辑运算符，赋值运算符，最后是三目运算符。

我们只需要记住两点：

  1. 任何一个逻辑运算符的优先级低于任何一个关系运算符。
  2. 移位运算符的优先级比算术运算符低，比关系运算符高。

同类型运算符，相对理解没那么困难。乘、除、求余优先级相同，大于加、减法优先级。两个移位运算符优先级相同。在关系运算符中==和!=比其他四个优先级低，其他四个优先级相同。

逻辑运算符的优先级都不同，所有按位运算符的优先级要比顺序运算符的优先级高，“与”比“或”的优先级高。按位异或运算符的优先级介于按位与和按位或之间。

所有赋值运算符的优先级是一样的，结合方式从右向左。

2.3 注意作为语句结束标志的分号

分号多写一个可能不会造成太大的问题，但是少了一个，很可能导致本来没关系的两个部分结合在一起。如：

2.4 switch语句

C语言中switch语句会在case开始的位置一直执行下去，直到遇见break才会跳出，所以如果忘记加break，有时会导致某些不想发生的事发生。但有时也可以运用这个性质来方便编程。如：

这段代码本意是在x==0且y==0时调用error函数，在x!=0的情况，执行else结构体内的东西，但是实际上它的表现与如下代码相同。

这是因为C语言的一个规则：else始终与同一对括号内最近的未匹配的if相结合。

entry.title: C陷阱与缺陷读书笔记 Part.1
entry.content:
第1章 词法“陷阱”

​ 符号指的是程序的一个基本组成单元，其作用相当于句子中的单词。而组成符号的字符序列则不同，同一组字符序列在某个上下文环境中属于一个符号，而在另一种上下文环境可能属于完全不同的另一种符号。

如p->s = “->”，两个“-”的含义完全不同。

前者是符号->的组成部分，后者是字符串的组成部分。

1.1 =不同于==

“=”为赋值运算符，“==”为关系运算符。
我们有时候写代码会无意中将“==”写成“=”，如：

1.2 &和|不同于&&和||

​ 按位运算与逻辑运算也有不同，按位运算符会将每位进行运算后，产生一个值，而逻辑运算符是将每一位进行比较，最后得到0或1，如果使用错误会导致很多意想不到的错误或看起来正常的隐患。

1.3 词法分析中的“贪心法”

​ C语言中的某些符号如“/”、“*”、和“=”，只有一个字符长，称为单字符符号，而类似于“*/“、”==“以及标识符，包括了多个字符，称为多字符符号。C编译器读入字符/后，又跟了一个字符*，那么编译器就要做出判断，是分开还是将他们合起来作为一个符号对待。
​ C语言处理这种情况可以归纳为：每一个符号应该包含尽可能多的字符。即，程序从左到右一个一个字符地读入，如果字符可能组成一个符号，那么再读入下一个字符，判断已经读入的两个字符组成的字符串是否可能是一个符号的组成部分；如果可以，继续读入下一个字符，重复上述判断，直到读入的字符组成的字符串已不再可能组成一个有意义的符号。
​ 需要注意除了字符与字符常量，符号的中间不能嵌有空白(空格符、制表符和换行符)。如：==是单个符号，而== (是个空格)是两个符号。
例子：

​ 同样，如果/是判断下一个符号读入的第一个字符，而它后面紧跟着*，则无论上下文如何，这两个字符都会被当做一个符号“/*”，表示一段注释的开始。

​ 所以如下语句：
​ y = x/*p /* P指向除数 */
​ 本意是将x除以p指向的值，商赋给y，而实际上编译器会将/*理解为注释的开始，编译器将不断读入字符，直到*/出现为止。

​ 所以将语句改写成
​ y = x / *p 或
​ y = x/(*p)
​ 才是原意。

​ 老版本的C语言允许使用=+来代表现在+=的含义。这种编译器会将
​ a=-1;
​ 理解为
​ a =- 1;
​ 即
​ a = a - 1;
(怪不得平时最好要用空格分开，我以前最喜欢连着写了…. 不过现在使用的编译器好像都没有这种特性了。)
​ 那么在这种编译器下，上面提到的
​ a=/*b；
​ 会被当做
​ a =/ *b;
​ 即
​ a = a / *b；

1.4 整形常量

​ 如果一个整形常量的第一个字符是数字0，那么该常量会被视作八进制数。

1.5 字符与字符串

​ C语言中单引号和双引号含义不同，切勿弄混。
​ 单引号引起的一个字符实际上代表一个整数，整数值对应于该字符在编译器采用的字符集中的序列值。
​ 双引号引起的字符串，代表的是一个指向无名数组起始字符的指针，该数组被双引号之间的字符以及一个额外的二进制为0的字符 ‘/0’初始化。

课后题

  1. a+++++b的含义是什么？
    a++ ++ +b，等价于(a++)++ +b不会通过编译，因为自增自减不能当左值。

entry.title: 八、长难句综合分析策略
entry.content:
核心战术

​ 假设：句中的that没省略，且用于引导从句。as、for做介词，后跟的是名词。and并列的不是动词或句子，ed结尾的词是done和adj(就先当它不是动词)。

​ 步骤: >step 1.找出句中所有的谓语以及常见从句引导词，并按顺序写下来
​ >step 2.清点谓语、引导词数量并代入等式检测，直至等式成立。
​ 等式：谓语动词数-常见从句引导词数=1
​ → 不满足就是有假设不成立，逐个排除即可

如果结果 ≠ 1
结果＞1 → that省略了，and或but并列谓语了，as、for做引导词了
结果 < 1 → 谓语找漏了(ed结尾的是did)、that做代词、引导词找多了、make sb do sth特殊结构、if done 特殊结构。

​ >step 3.引导词按向后就近原则分配，引导词与紧邻其后出现的国王必属一家。最后剩下的孤家寡人就是主句谓语！
​ >step 4.主句、因果条件类状从、to do优先翻译。

练习：

​ What is harder to establish is whether the productivity revolution that businessmen assume they are presiding over is for real.
​ 找词：what is is whether that assume are is 5-3＝2 → 这里没and，for没有做引导词→那么肯定是that省略了。
​ → 哪里有问题？谓语扎堆的地方有问题！
​ → what is is whether that assume (that) are is 5-4 = 1 √
​ → 就近配对→ (what is) is [whether (that assume) (that are) is ]
​ → What is harder to establish is whether the productivity revolution that businessmen assume (that) they are presiding over is for real.

​ Many European schools introduce the concept of professional training early on in order to make sure children are properly equipped for the professions they want to join.
​ 找词：introduce are want 3-0=0 → 没and，没as和for → that省略了
​ → introduce (that) are (that) want 3-1=1√
​ → 就近配对 → introduce (that are) (that want)
​ → Many European schools introduce the concept of professional training early on in order to make sure (that) children are properly equipped for the professions (that) they want to join.

​ For a while it looked as though the making of semiconductors, which America had invented and which sat at the heart of the new computer age, was going to be the next casualty.
​ 找词：as though which had which sat was 3-3＝0 → looked应该是谓语
​ → looked as though which had which sat was 4-3=1 √
​ → 就近配对 → looked [as though (which had) (which sat) was]
​ → For a while it looked as though the making of semiconductors, which America had invented and which sat at the heart of the new computer age, was going to be the next casualty.

entry.title: 七、特殊语法专题
entry.content:
(一) 定语、主语、宾语的后置

  1. 定语后置：定语本题超过1个词时需要放在所修饰的名词之后，避免喧宾夺主。
    The man in the stage is Monkey.
    The man surrounded by students is Monkey.
    The man who is surrounded by students is Monkey.

  2. 主语后置：it做形式主语—-避免头重脚轻，使语句结构更易识别
    That he came to party was a surprise.
    → It was a surprise that he came to party.(原主语是句子→ It is…that)

    Giving up smoking is difficult for him.（原主语是非谓语结构→It is …to do）
    → It is difficult for him to give up smoking.

    That a single man in possession of a good fortune must be in want of a wife is a truth universally acknowledged.
    → It is a truth universally acknowledged that a single man in possession of a good fortune must be in want of a wife.

  3. 宾语后置
    ① it 做形式宾语—-突出“主谓宾补”、“主谓双宾”句型的主干结构
    We consider that we sleep eight hours a day desirable.
    → We consider it desirable that we sleep eight hours a day.
    → We consider it desirable to sleep eight hours a day.

    I find managing English grammar difficult.
    → I find it difficult to manage English grammar.

    I think that studying eight hours a day is too much.
    → I think (that) it is too much to study eight hour.

    He makes learning English well his goal.
    → He makes it his goal to learn English well.
    ② 谓语+长宾语+补语结构后置 → 谓语+补语+宾语（难）
    We often define what earlier generation considered as weakness of will as addictions.
    → We often define as addictions what earlier generation considered as weakness of will.

    The revolution made the recruitment of female sex into public industry possible.
    → The revolution made possible the recruitment of female sex into public industry.

(二) 强调语气

  1. It is/was… that… 句型强调主语、宾语、状语
    强调公式：It is/was + 被强调部分 + that + 原句其他部分

    He met Monkey yesterday.
    强调主语：It was he that met Monkey yesterday.
    强调宾语：It was Monkey that he met yesterday.
    强调状语：It was yesterday that he met Monkey.

    造句：直到昨天他才遇到Monkey(not…until)

            He didn't meet Monkey until yesterday.        →It was not until yesterday that he met Monkey.

    强调句的本质：重要内容优先说明！众星捧月！

  2. do，did，does 强调谓语（仅限现在时和过去时）
    将所强调的谓语动词原型分离，并添加do，did，does 承接其时态与单三特征
    如：take → do take takes → does take took → did take

    Remember to close the window.
    → Do remember to close the window.

    He goes to his company on foot.
    → He does go to his company on foot.

    I finished my homework.
    → I did finish my homework.

  3. so that，too to，such that 强调程度

    ① so…that…强调形容词、副词的程度

    ​ She is so beautiful that Tom cannot take his eyes off her.
    ​ She walks so gracefully that Tom cannot take his off her.

    ② too…to… 强调性形容词、副词的程度+引向否定性结果

    ​ She is so beautiful that she must be an angle.
    ​ → She is too beautiful to be a human/mortal.

    ​ She walks so slowly that she cannot arrive there in time.
    ​ → She walks too slowly to arrive there in time.
    ③ such…that…强调名词的程度

    ​ His arms are so long that he could almost touch his feet.
    ​ → He has such long arms that he could almost touch his feet.

    ​ He is so clever that he finished the exam in only 30 minutes.
    ​ → He is such a genius that he finished the exam in only 30 minutes.

(三) 倒装

​ 存在即合理，无需刻意还原语序！
​ Here is a ticket for you.
​ Now comes your turn.
​ Here he comes.

​ Only yesterday did he find out that his watch was missing.
​ Not until I saw the score did I realize that I choose the wrong teacher.
​ So small was the mark that I could hardly see it.
​ So quickly did the workmen finish their work that they were given a bonus.

(四) 插入语

​ 情景特点：节外生枝，心血来潮。识别特征：双逗号包夹

  1. 不稳反语法规则的插入语

    做同位语：Steve Jobs, CEO of Apple, was rich.
    做定语：Steve Jobs , who was the CEO of Apple, was rich.
    做状语：Bill Gates, in my view, is a great man.

  2. 违反语法规则的插入语—-做（主）谓
    Bill Gates, she said, is a great man.
    Monkey, believe it or not, is a human.

entry.title: 六、从句专题
entry.content:
三大从句

从句=从属于主句的次要句子
特征：有从句引导词(如：that…)，有从句谓语
名词性从句：整个从句当一个名词，可做主、宾、表、同位语等
I know that you are smart.
定语从句：整个从句当一个后置的形容词，用于修饰前面的名词
I like Lucy who works very hard.
状语从句：整个从句做状语，用于修饰说明主句
I will talk to you when you come back.

(一) 名词性从句

  1. 如何快速识别名词性从句？（特征）
    看所属的主句缺不缺名词！（名从的核心特征：所属主句缺名词）

    I know that you are smart.What you are saying is wrong.I come from where you belong.

    主句缺名词，且该从句出现在名词该出现的地方，必然是名词性从句！
    反之，主句不缺名词，从句一般不是名词性从句，只有一个特殊情况例外！
    →那就是同位语从句

  2. 同位语从句
    同位语：一个名词解释或说明前方的另一个名词

    Monkey(名词)，our English teacher(名词-同位语)，is ugly.We(名词 ) Chinese people（名词-同位语） are hard-working.

    同位语从句：一个名词性从句作名词，解释或说明前方的另一个名词

    You should know the fact <span style='color:blue;background:背景颜色;font-size:文字大小;font-family:字体;'>that Monkey is a human</span>.The news <span style='color:blue;background:背景颜色;font-size:文字大小;font-family:字体;'>that our team has won</span> is true.I like the idea <span style='color:blue;background:背景颜色;font-size:文字大小;font-family:字体;'>that altitude determines altitude</span>.

    同位语从句与that定语从句的共同点：都针对前方的名词，主句都不缺名词
    不同点：同位语从句解释名词的具体内涵，不缺成分，定从只是修饰（…的）

    I like the idea that attitude determines altitude.I like the idea that you mentioned.

    同位语从句出现频率不高，特征明显：

    **idea,fact,thought,theory,news,concept等无具体内涵的概念词+that**

  3. 一般名词性从句（主语从句、宾语从句、表语从句、名词从句）
    ① 从句句义与陈述句句义的基本转换逻辑
    You are doing sth.
    What are you doing.
    What you are doing is right.
    名词性从句，所问即所答。
    几乎所有从句引导词都可以引导名词性从句！(且一般都是疑问词)
    that，which，what，who，when，where，why，how，if，whether…
    ② 常见名词性从句可以转换成定语从句理解

(二) 从句类型的判断与主要特征

  1. 如何判断从句的类型？（特征）
    特殊情况：idea，thought等概念词+that，优先考虑同位语从句
    ① 看其所属的主句缺不缺名词！（名从核心特征：所属主句缺名词）
    ② 如果主句不缺名词，就是定语从句或状语从句，起次要修饰作用
    定语从句：整个从句当一个后置的形容词，用于修饰前面的名词
    状语从句：整个从句做状语，用于修饰说明主句

  2. 横跨名从、定从、状从三界的流氓引导词：when，where
    ① when

     That is <span style='color:blue;background:背景颜色;font-size:文字大小;font-family:字体;'>when I was young</span>.   名从：这是我年轻的时候。

    ​ I love the time when I was young.
    ​ 定从：我爱（我年轻时的）那段时光。（从句缺成分）I was young at the time.

    ​ I loved pop music when I was young.
    ​ 状从：我喜欢流行音乐，在我年轻的时候。 I loved pop music at that time.
    when做定从或者状从，一律无脑翻译成“那时”。

    ② where

    That is <span style='color:blue;background:背景颜色;font-size:文字大小;font-family:字体;'>where I used to live</span>.    名从：这是我曾住过的地方。

    ​ I love Beijing where I used to live in.
    ​ 定从：我爱（我曾住过的）北京。（从句缺成分）I used to live in Beijing.

    ​ I live where I used to live.
    ​ 状从：我住在我曾住过的地方。I live in Beijing.(状语)

    where 做定从或状从，一律无脑翻译成“那地”
    其他定语从句与状语从句的常见区别特征：引导词不同

(三) 定语从句

​ 定语从句：整个从句当一个后置的形容词，用于修饰前面的名词
​ 名词：人、物、事
​ 定从常见引导词：that，which，who，whose，whom

​ 定语从句所修饰的名词也成为“先行词”。
​ 定语从句内部不完整，缺名词，把先行词放回后才构成完整的句子。

  1. that（那个）→ 人、物、事
    He is the man that loves me.
    He is the man that I love.
    He is the man that I come here to find.

  2. which（哪个）→物、事
    RUC is the school which is behind PKU.
    I know the accident which is horrible.

    非限制性定语从句—-修饰前面整句话所说的“事”，而不是某个词

    I am Monkey，which is known to all of my student.He died in an accident，which makes me sad.

    which修饰名词还是主句这件事？which是不是非限定？

    → **which优先理解成“Ta”，说不通就改为“这件事”。**

  3. who（谁），whom（宾格谁），whose（谁的）→ 人
    He is the man who kills Tom.
    He is the man who I killed.
    He is the man whom I killed.
    → I kill the man.
    whom能干的事who基本都能干！
    He is the man whose wife is beautiful.
    → The man ‘s wife is beautiful.
    He is the man whose company is on fire.
    → The man ’s company is on fire.

  4. 定语从句的介词前置（除that外）
    He is my teacher who I learn a lot from.
    → 老外会觉得不正常，不自然！→定从中的相关介词前置。
    He is the teacher from whom I learn a lot.（唯一一个whom能做，但who不能做的事）

    This is the place in which I was born.
    → This is the place where I was born.
    介词+which结构往往可以与where、when相互转化

(四) 状语从句

​ 状语从句：整个从句作状语，用于修饰说明主句，常见引导词：
​ 时间地点类：where，when，while，before，after，since，until，till，as
​ 原因类：because，since，as
​ 条件类：if，unless，whether
​ 让步转折类：though，although，even if，while

  1. 大部状语从句成分完整，语序正常，直接翻译即可得到句义。
    You will be punished if you don’t finish your task.

  2. ever系状语从句
    whatever，whenever，wherever，whoever，however…
    xx+ever → ① no matter xx 无论… ② 疑问词（及其小弟）置于主句后

    Whatever you do，I will forgive you.
    → No matter what you do，I will forgive you.

    Whenever you come，I will beat you.
    → No matter when you come，I will beat you.

    However strong you are，I will beat you.
    → No matter how strong you are，I will beat you.

从句类型的判别思路：


PS：见到it..that，so…that 单独判断。

(五) 从句的省略

  1. 定从、名从引导词的省略（that引导）

    I know that you are smart.
    → I know (that) you are smart.

    That you are smart is known to all.
    → (That) You are smart is known to all. (are，is谁是主句谓语？混淆不清，此时不能省略)

    I know the boy that I met.
    → I know the boy I met.

    I know the boy that kills Tom.
    → I know the boy kills Tom.（表意不明，不能省略）

小结：名词性从句做宾语，定语从句修饰的名词在从句中宾语时，引导词可省略。

  1. 状语从句中，主语和be动词的省略（引导词+非谓语）
    When he was surrounded by others，he went angry.
    → when surrounded by others，he went angry.

    Although he worked hard，he failed the exam.
    → Although working hard，he failed the exam.

从句主语与主句谓语一致时，可省略主语(及其be动词)，剩余动词非谓化。
→ 见到缺主语，没谓语的从句，加be补主，说不通就加be补it

​ If (it is) possible, I will come to see you.

  1. 支配、建议类谓语后的宾语从句可省略should
    支配类：order，commend，insist，require，demand…
    建议类：suggest，advise，propose，recommend…

    ① The politician insisted that Tom (should) be arrested.
    ② The doctor advised that he (should) have an operation to save his life.

  2. “xx很重要“型的it…that形式主语结构中，that从句可以省略should
    ① It is important that enough money (should) be collected to support this project.
    ② It is urgent that a meeting (should) be arranged before we make the final decision.

entry.title: 五、并列句专题
entry.content:
三大并列连词：and，but，or

可并列的对象：
① 同类单词、短语（普通并列）
② 谓语动词、句子（并列句）

可并列的数量：
① 并列二者 A and B；A but B；A or B
② 并列二者以上 A,B,and C；A,B,C, and D； A,B, but C；A,B, or C

(一) and的并列用法

  1. 并列同类的词与短语
    She is beautiful and graceful.
    Tom and I are good friends.
    Tom , Jerry, and I are good friends.
    I study English to pass the exam and to broaden my horizon.
    Make the world a better place for you, for me, and for everyone.
    I know that you are smart and that you can relize your dream.

  2. 并列句子与谓语动词

    Tom is beautiful and Jerry is graceful .
    Thor get divorced , Tom and Jerry get married , and I remain single .
    I get up , I wash my face , and I go to school .（并列句子）

      → I  <span style='color:blue;background:背景颜色;font-size:文字大小;font-family:字体;'>get up</span> ,  <span style='color:blue;background:背景颜色;font-size:文字大小;font-family:字体;'>wash my face</span> ，and  <span style='color:blue;background:背景颜色;font-size:文字大小;font-family:字体;'>go to school</span> .（并列谓语/省略）

    Study hard and you will be rewarded.（祈使句+结果）

(二) but的并列用法

  1. 并列同类的词与短语(强调的是but后面的内容)
    He is gentle but ugly.(但是)
    His gentle，clever，but ugly.
    He is not a human but a vampire.(不是…而是)

    Tom invited everyone but Jerry.(除了)
    He is nothing but a liar.（他就是个骗子）
    He is anything but a liar.（他绝不是一个骗子）

  2. 并列句子与谓语动词
    She loves Hello Kitty but I hate it.
    He succeeded in English but failed in Math.
    English is important，but Chinese is also important.
    I say nothing but keep silent.(除了)

  3. not but 结构
    He didn’t go to school but went to a web bar.
    The value of life lies not in the length of days，but in the use that we make of them.
    I study English not to pass the exam but to broaden my horizon.
    It ’s not the video but what doctors did during the epidemic that made us moved.（强调句）

  4. not only…but also…
    He is not only a teacher but also a mentor.(并列词)
    Not only is he a teacher，(but) he is also a mentor.
    He not went to a web bar，but also spent three days there.

    →若Not only提到句首，则把谓语战斗群的第一个动词提到主语前→Not only did he go to a web bar，(but) he also spend three days there.

    *Not only his team won the game，but also he got an MVP.

    →Not only did his team win the game，(but)  he also got an MVP.* <这两句存疑，**我觉着后面倒装的用法是对的，前面没倒装的那个句子不太严谨**，没在网上搜到not only在句首连接两个完整句子时可以不倒装的用法>

    not only but also句型并列两个独立句子时，前半句经常部分倒装，后半句可能会省略but

(三) or的并列用法

  1. 并列同类的词与短语（仅限否定句、疑问句、不确定性的句子）
    I don’t know your name or your number.
    I don’t like wine or tea.
    Would you like some wine or tea？<否定里相当于and，肯定句/疑问句里面表示或者>
  2. 并列句子与谓语动词（仅限否定句、疑问句、不确定性的句子）
    I am wrong，or you are wrong.
    I could go to school or go to a web bar.
    Go to school，or you will waste your precious time.（祈使句+反向结果）
    Study hard and you will be rewarded.（祈使句+结果）
  3. either or(不是，就是)与neither nor(既不是，也不是)
    She will come back either today or tomorrow.
    Either I am wrong or you are wrong.
    Neither Tom nor Jerry knows the answer.
    The author neither worried nor cared about public opinion.

(四) 并不存在的“时态一致原则”

​ In fact, plagiarism was, is and will continue to be a shared problem in the world, academically and non-academically.

entry.title: 四、非谓语专题
entry.content:
三大非谓语

​ to do（不定式）强调未来性或目的性

​ doing （现在分词）强调正在进行的状态或名词性

​ done （过去分词）强调被动状态或完成、结束的状态

非谓语就是不能做谓语，其余做什么都行

​ ① 做名词（主语、宾语、表语、其他名词）

​ ② 做定语（修饰名词）

​ ③ 其他修饰成分（状语、补语）

(一) 非谓语做名词

非谓语做名词（主语、宾语、表语及其他名词）
仅doing、to do可顶替名词位置

  1. doing 做名词
    doing做名词时，意思最接近其动词本意，故也称为“动名词”

    Seeing is believing.Learning English requires a lot of effort.

  2. to do做主语、宾语
    To learn English is to understand the world in another language.

    (二) 非谓语做定语（修饰名词）

    前置定语（1个词）；后置定语（多于1个词）

  3. 前置定语
    仅doing、done可做前置定语，用法极为接近一般形容词

    He is a rising star.You will manage English grammar in the following hours.She loves the fallen leaves.We had an organized trip.

    前置定语的用法与意思都像形容词，频繁使用后干脆做个形容词！

    ​ excite v.使兴奋
    ​ The story excites the boy. 这个故事使男孩兴奋

    ​ the exciting story 使人兴奋起来的故事
    ​ → exciting adj.令人兴奋的 The story is exciting(the boy).

    ​ the excited boy 被整兴奋了的男孩
    ​ → excited adj. 兴奋的 The boy is excited(by the story).

    ​ interest v.使感兴趣 interesting 令人感兴趣的 interested 感兴趣的
    ​ 并不是“ing 形容物，ed 形容人”

    ​ Li Ming interests me.
    ​ The interesting Li Ming

  4. 后置定语

    **doing…、done by sth、to do **都可以做后置定语，是难点！
    难点1： done与谓语动词的区分，ed = 形容词？非谓语？动词过去式？

    Much of the language used to describe monetary policy makes it sound like a precise science.**解决办法：**优先找到一定能是谓语的单词

    难点2： 长难句中的理解和翻译

    The true enemies of science are those who question the evidence

    supporting the pollution of the ozone layer and global warming.

    **解决办法：**修饰性非谓语变从句， <span style='color:red;background:背景颜色;font-size:文字大小;font-family:字体;'>一看到无法理解的修饰性谓语，在前面+that be，先当句子去理解</span>

    后置定语可转换成定语从句理解 +be 补 that

    The man speaking to the teacher is Tom ’s father.
    → The man（that is）speaking to the teacher is Tom ‘s father.

    The girl surrounded by others is Lucy.
    → The girl（that is）surrounded by others is Lucy.

    Much of the language used to describe monetary policy makes it sound like a precise science.
    → Much of the language (that is) used to describe monetary policy makes it sound like a precise science.

    The true enemies of science are those who question the evidence supporting the pollution of the ozone layer and global warming.
    → The true enemies of science are those who question the evidence (that is) supporting the pollution of the ozone layer and global warming.

(三) 非谓语做其他修饰成分（状语、补语）

  1. to do 表目的
    ① to do 表目的（状语）

    <span style='color:blue;background:背景颜色;font-size:文字大小;font-family:字体;'>To improve your English</span>，you need Monkey.I come to the class <span style='color:blue;background:背景颜色;font-size:文字大小;font-family:字体;'>to study English</span>.

    ② 表意料之外的结果（状语）

    He hurried to the station，<span style='color:blue;background:背景颜色;font-size:文字大小;font-family:字体;'>only to find no bus</span>.<span style='color:blue;background:背景颜色;font-size:文字大小;font-family:字体;'>Only to find</span> that the joker is me.

  2. doing，done

① **“加be补主” **说得通时（动作发出者通常是主句主语）

​ (He is) Working in the factory，he was an advanced worker.
​ He dropped the glass，(he is) breaking it into pieces.
​ (Microsoft is)Created in 1975，Microsoft has become a tech giant.
​ He is handsome，(he is) envied by many others.

② “加be补主” 说不通时，“加be补我”或“额外补如果”

​ (I am) Judging form his appearance，he must be an actor.
​ (I am) Generally speaking，girls are more careful.
​ (If) Time (is) permitting （us），we ’ll do another two exercise.
​ (If I am)Given more time，I ‘ll be able to do it better.

(四) 三大非谓语的复合语态

​ to do： 我来上课是为了被Monkey指导
​ I come to the class to be guided by Monkey.
​ doing：被Monkey指导着，我感觉很好
​ Being guided by Monkey，I feel good
​ done：我进了一个被Monkey指导的班
​ I have joined a class guided by Monkey.

entry.title: 三、简单句-词性与成分
entry.content:
(一) 简单句与复合句

简单句：只有一个谓语的句子。

Monkey is a teacher.

复合句：拥有多个谓语的句子。(即句中包含并列句或从句)

Monkey is a teacher and I am his student.

Monkey is the teacher that I choose.

简单句的核心是谓语，谓语的核心是动词。

(二)谓语的核心-动词与系动词(v.)

1.动词(谁做了什么事)

① 及物动词vt. 后面可以直接跟名词(宾语)

​ I love music.

​ He has a book.

② 不及物动词 vi. 后面不能直接跟名词(宾语)

​ Birds can fly.

​ I sleep here.

​ I work at home.

③ 及物动词与不及物动词的判别问题(没必要)

​ They are playing the piano.

​ They are playing.

2.系动词(谁怎么了)

① 状态类：be,am,is,are,was,were
② 持续类：keep,remain,stay,exist…
③ 像类：seem,appear,look…
④ 感官类： feel,look,smell,sound,taste,seem…
⑤ 变化类：become,grow,turn,get,prove…

系动词与普通动词的核心区别：

​ ① 系动词后可直接跟形容词

​ She is beautiful.

​ It tastes good.

​ ② 系动词无需使用被动语态

​ The new policy proves unsuccessful.

​ ③ 系动词后接的形容词或名词为“表语”

将系动词视作一类用法特殊的动词即可，拒绝“主系表”与“主谓宾”二分。

(三)简单句的基本类型(个别语法可能不严谨，但不影响做题理解，老师是在替我们做减法)

  1. 主谓宾结构（谁做了什么事）

    I love music.

    ZuckerBerg created Facebook. → Facebook is created by ZuckerBerg.

    主语与宾语的核心必须是名词n.

    English is a beautiful language.

  2. 谓语或谓宾结构（祈使句）
    Stop！ Get out！ Let it go. Heal the world.

  3. 主谓结构（不及物动词）
    I come. I see. I conquer.
    The world has changed.
    I work at home.

  4. 主谓双宾（重点积累）
    I give him a present.
    Monkey teaches us English.
    She made him her assistant.

  5. 主谓宾宾补结构（无需刻意识别补语）

    补语：对所修饰的名词起补充说明作用
    The news made me happy.
    I found myself in dark.
    The police offer calls him back.

    无需刻意识别补语！无需区分补语与第二宾语的区别！

(四)简单句的修饰与补充

1.名词(主语、宾语等)的底裤—-冠词与代词(a,an,the,my,this…)

可以(但未必)裸奔的名词：
不可数名词 Water is valuable. Love is an emotion.
复数名词 Sutdents are my best friend.
大写专有名词 Boris Johnson is the prime minister of UK.

必须穿底裤的名词：单数可数名词

2. 名词(主语、宾语等)的修饰—-定语

定语是用来修饰、限定、说明名词的。常见的定语有：形容词、名词、介词短语

① 形容词作定语 adj.（前置定语）
MIT is a famous American university.
She is a young little girl.

​ 形容词的修饰—-副词 adv.
​ MIT is a very famous American university.

② 名词作定语 n.（前置定语）
I am an English teacher.
There is a tea cup.
多定语排序口诀：美小圆旧黄，法国木书房
其他-大小-新旧-颜色-产地-材质-功能-被修饰名词
an interesting little red French oil painting.

③ 介词短语作定语 prep.（后置定语）

​ 当定语本体由多个词构成时，需要放在所修饰的名词之后。

​ The boy in the classroom is sleeping.

​ The wealth of the nation belongs to its people.

3. 谓语、整句的修饰与补充说明—-状语

状语一般用于说明地点、时间、原因、目的、结果、条件、方向、程度、方式等。
常见的状语有：副词、介词短语

① 副词做状语 adv.
We should carefully make our plan.

​ He won the game finally.

​ Generally，it needs 12 month to prepare for this exam.

② 介词短语作状语
​ 【地点】He studies at home.
​ 【时间】He studies in the morning.
​ 【目的】He studies for a better future.
​ 【方式】He studies in a wise way.
​ 【伴随】He studies with monkey.
​ 【比较】He studies than his friend.
​ 【结果】As a consequence，their hearts and lungs are affected.

(五）词性与成分的关系

词性：词汇的根本属性（固定、有限）
成分：词汇在特定语句中起到的功能作用（灵活、需要分析）

主干成分：主 n. ；谓 v. ；宾 n.
修饰成分：定 adj. ；状；补（可忽略）

删除定状无伤大雅，漏掉名词或动词则伤筋动骨，出现语法硬伤

简单句构思步骤：

① 谓语（v.） 干啥
② 主语、宾语（n.） 谁做了啥事
③ 名词的冠词、定语修饰  什么样的谁做了什么样的事
④ 谓语、整句的状语修饰 谁在何时何地以何种方式和目的做了什么事
⑤ 形容词的副词修饰

语法分析的核心思路：

词性→成分→语义 ×
词性→主谓宾→修饰关系（对象）→语义 √
成分只是语法分析的结果，词性才是语法分析的起点和根本依据！

(六）非谓语可充当的成分

主、谓、宾（主句主干）；定、状、补（次要修饰成分）

谓语 → 必须是动词，且只有一个
主语、宾语 → 名词
定语 → 形容词为主，名词也可以，用来修饰名词
状语 → 副词，各类介词短语，补充修饰说明 动词、句子

非谓语=非·谓语
除了绝对不能当谓语以外，非谓语可以做其他任何成分！

entry.content:
1.基本时态语态

时态排布

3.谓语的识别

哪些形式的动词一定不是谓语？

​ been，being，doing

哪些形式的动词不一定是谓语？

​ 动词ed(因为大部分动词的过去式did与过去分词done写法一致)

划出以下三句话的谓语部分

  • Being a teacher is his dream.
  • The President ‘s designated successor is his son.
  • Seeing is believing.

4.情态动词

entry.title: 一、重识语法
entry.content:
考研语法学什么？

  • 不影响理解意思的语法，不值得可以学习
  • 符合现有语言习惯的语法，无需刻意学习或分辨
  • 以理解意思为前提的语法概念，不值得浪费精力辨析
    如：状语/状语从句的细分
  • 降低我们理解效率的语法概念，不值得浪费精力辨析
    如：非限定定从吭哧吭哧分析半天
  • 严重影响我们理解、蒙猜句义的语法，才值得学习

重识语法

(在不考虑并列句的情况下)一句话只有一个谓语。
每一句话都是一个国家，而谓语就是这个国家的国王。
知道国王是谁很重要，认识国王的长相很重要，如何理解谓语之外的动词？

  • 并列句、从句、非谓语中的动词。
    一个正常的国家，有且只有一个国王。
    一个正常的句子，有且只有一个谓语。

然而，一个国家有如下“特殊情况”：

  1. 三国式的三足鼎立，三个国王谁都不服谁
    对应英语里的“并列句”，并列句的核心特点是一个并列连词+多个谓语，如：

    • I am a boy and she is a girl.
    • I get up and go to school.

  2. 国王把小部分土地分给了自己的儿子，这时儿子就是那片区域的小国王，但仍从属于、效忠于自己的父亲，真正的国王。

    对应英语中的“从句”，每个从句都有一个“引导词”来划定自己的领土范围，在领土范围内有自己的“小国王”，即从句谓语。
    • I am a student who loves English.
    • What you should always keep in mind is learning.

以上两种情况仍属于体制内，“和谐”地解决了权力冲突的问题。

  1. 除了国王外，还有其他高富帅(动词)想进入这个国家，怎么办？

    • 不让他进国门！—-用介词短语、名词等其他词性来表达动词含义。

    • 放进来之后疯狂迫害他！—-非谓语

      • 迫害高富帅的两种手段：

        1.粗暴毁容，面目全非
        ​ do → doing 或 do → done
        ​ 2.贴耻辱标签(此人已凉)
        ​ do → to do

​ 一个句子中不是谓语但却是动词的东西，一定要遭到变形、阉割、烙印，变成to do，doing，done的形式，以跟谓语动词产生明显区别，才能在句子中生存。

语法学习的心得：

  1. 英语是经验学科，语法是经验中总结的结果而非原因。
  2. 符合语法规则的未必是地道的、正确的。
  3. 语言习惯大过天，大量阅读和吸收地道的语句才是王道。（英语多被动，少主动）
  4. 不要问为什么不能这样写？可不可以这样写？
  5. 重词性，轻成分！成分是语法分析的结果而非成因。
  6. 不要用自己有限的语法，否定无限的语言可能性。
  7. 从一般到特殊，切勿委曲求全！
